Don, everything is connected somehow or else we can make it so.=A0 lol=A0=
=A0 I don't know about eh EMF part but I do know that I am in an area of Me=
xico that get very few radio stations...that is except when it is about to =
storm.=A0 I just noticed that a few weeks ago and will be ready with my RS =
hack for the next one.=A0 Also, I recall that a few months ago one of our m=
embers had an actual EVP capture with the hack where the message was someth=
ing to the effect that "the Hack worked best when it was raining."=A0 Now t=
his may not have anything to do with your subject of EMF but WTF, there it =
is.=A0=A0=A0 lol=A0=A0 ron l

--- On Tue, 11/11/08, don powell <dpowell7299=
@...> wrote:

From: don powell <dpowell7299@...>
Subject: [EVP-=
ITC] This has nothing to do with ITC or EVP but is related :)
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, November 11, 2008, 11:46 AM







Now that y=
ou read the warning...

I had to mention this somewhere so I thought I woul=
d post it here as you people seem more open to it than my other email group=
s.

I bought a cell phone (EMF) sensor a few days ago.=A0 You know like the=
 K2 they used to "supposedly" (jury is still out) talk to ghosts but cheape=
r.

Well as an EMF sensor, I expected a number of things to set it off.=A0 =
2 things:

1) Hardly anything did set it off.=A0 I was amazed by this.=A0 I=
 had to set it directly on my laptop to even pick up the 60 hz from the fan=
s.=A0 This surprised me.=A0 I had expected it to go nuts with all the wirel=
ess this and wireless that, TVs, TIVOs and laptop.=A0 Anyway I thought it w=
as interesting the level of shielding these days.

2) and my real point.=A0=
 We had a big thunder storm come through last night.=A0 I turned it on expe=
cting it to go off when nearby lightning strikes hit.=A0 The amazing thing =
was that it would go off when there was no lightning and no thunder.=A0 But=
 some really close strikes did nothing but barely move the needle.

I'm not=
 exactly looking for answers but I was surprised about the storm.=A0 Next s=
torm I'll have to see if it goes off a little before a big strike.=A0 It se=
emed like minutes to me between them but I was not paying that much attenti=
on.

So, sorry for the off-topic but I did warn you ahead of time so you co=
uld just delete.

BTW if anyone has any ideas on that part 2, I'd love to h=
ear it but it probably needs to be direct email instead of to the list.

Do=
n
 














      
--0-589822742-1226460398=:60010
Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;">Don, everything is connected somehow or else we can make it so.  lol   I don't know about eh EMF part but I do know that I am in an area of Mexico that get very few radio stations...that is except when it is about to storm.  I just noticed that a few weeks ago and will be ready with my RS hack for the next one.  Also, I recall that a few months ago one of our members had an actual EVP capture with the hack where the message was something to the effect that "the Hack worked best when it was raining."  Now this may not have anything to do with your subject of EMF but WTF, there it is.    lol   ron l<BR><BR>--- On <B>Tue, 11/11/08, don powell <I><dpowell7299@...></I></B> wrote:<BR>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: don powell <dpowell7299@...><BR>Subject: [EVP-ITC] This has nothing to do with ITC or EVP but is related :)<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Tuesday, November 11, 2008, 11:46 AM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv2008831174>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>
<DIV style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman, new york, times, serif">Now that you read the warning...<BR><BR>I had to mention this somewhere so I thought I would post it here as you people seem more open to it than my other email groups.<BR><BR>I bought a cell phone (EMF) sensor a few days ago.  You know like the K2 they used to "supposedly" (jury is still out) talk to ghosts but cheaper.<BR><BR>Well as an EMF sensor, I expected a number of things to set it off.  2 things:<BR><BR>1) Hardly anything did set it off.  I was amazed by this.  I had to set it directly on my laptop to even pick up the 60 hz from the fans.  This surprised me.  I had expected it to go nuts with all the wireless this and wireless that, TVs, TIVOs and laptop.  Anyway I thought it was interesting the level of shielding these days.<BR><BR>2) and my real point.  We had a big thunder storm come through last night.  I turned it
 on expecting it to go off when nearby lightning strikes hit.  The amazing thing was that it would go off when there was no lightning and no thunder.  But some really close strikes did nothing but barely move the needle.<BR><BR>I'm not exactly looking for answers but I was surprised about the storm.  Next storm I'll have to see if it goes off a little before a big strike.  It seemed like minutes to me between them but I was not paying that much attention.<BR><BR>So, sorry for the off-topic but I did warn you ahead of time so you could just delete.<BR><BR>BTW if anyone has any ideas on that part 2, I'd love to hear it but it probably needs to be direct email instead of to the list.<BR><BR>Don<BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>



      
--0-589822742-1226460398=:60010--
